#Text=Remaining US troops exit Iraq
#Text=Wednesday , December 21 , 2011
#Text=The last convoy of US soldiers crosses the border from Iraq into Kuwait , ending the eight-year long Iraq War .
#Text=Image : Cpl . Jordan Johnson , US Army .
#Text=The last convoy of US soldiers crossed the border from Iraq into Kuwait on Sunday , effectively bringing the controversial eight-year long Iraq War to an end .
#Text=The final convoy , containing around a hundred US military vehicles with five hundred troops , exited Iraq at 0738 AST ( 0438 UTC ) Sunday .
#Text=Private First Class Martin Lamb described the departure as " a good feeling ... knowing this is going to be the last mission out of here " .

column1: #Text=The Iraq War , which commenced in 2003 on the pretext of Iraq possessing weapons of mass destruction , which later turned out to be false , was responsible for toppling the regime of Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein and introducing a democratic government within Iraq .
#Text=In the aftermath of Hussein 's downfall , a violent , religion-based conflict broke out between those of Shia Islam faith and Sunni Islam communities , reaching its peak in 2006 .
#Text=The following year , a large number of US troops were sent into Iraq ; the number of sectarian and insurgent attacks subsequently declined .
#Text=The Iraq War involved a maximum of over 170,000 US troops , stationed in Iraq at more than 500 bases .
#Text=Tens of thousands to over 100,000 Iraqi citizens and close to 4,500 US troops were killed as a result of the war .
#Text=The financial cost of the Iraq War was almost US$ 1 trillion ( € 767 billion or £ 638 billion ) to the US government .
#Text=US presence in Iraq has been reduced to 157 soldiers in charge of military training at their embassy in the capital Baghdad and a minor base of US marines .
#Text=The US federal government reportedly intended to retain a minor counter-terrorism presence in Iraq , as well as the continuation of military training in the country .
#Text=However , negotiations between US government representatives and Iraqi officials were unsuccessful , as they failed to reach an agreement on legal matters , such as troop immunity .

#Text=In 2008 , the Bush administration had committed to withdrawing all US troops from Iraq by the end of 2011 , a movement which was announced by his successor and current US president Barack Obama in October 2011 .
#Text=Obama signified the conclusion of the war with Nouri al-Maliki , the prime minister of Iraq , earlier this month .
#Text=In a speech in North Carolina at Fort Bragg , Obama stated that the country US troops were leaving is now " sovereign , stable and self-reliant " .
#Text=US and Kuwaiti soldiers close the gate between Kuwait and Iraq , after the last military convoys passed through , signaling the end of the Iraq War .
#Text=Image : Cpl . Jordan Johnson , US Army .
#Text=Reaction to the US government 's decision has been mixed .
#Text=According to Voice of America opinion polls in the United States indicate that a majority of Americans believe the war lasted longer than it should have done .
#Text=Obama himself had opposed the war when he ran for president and vowed to end it .
#Text=News agencies report Iraqis glad to see the US leave , but concerned for the future .

#Text=Arab News reports that Iraqis also have mixed feelings , such as Safa , a 26-year old baker using a pseudonym , who said " I am proud — all Iraqis should be proud , like all those whose country has been freed .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=He also said ,  The situation will only improve if politicians work on fighting corruption and adopt reforms . "

column1: #Text=A 50-year-old mother calling herself Umm Mohammed said , " I do n't think we can ever forgive the Americans for what they did to us , from killings to terrorism .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Mohammed Abdelamir , 60 , said  We must all cooperate and work to improve the economy , the society , and begin rebuilding , and not fight because we are seeing that some politicians have already begun putting a stick in the wheel . "

column1: #Text=Other Iraqis who worked for Americans are fearful over their departure , fearing they may be killed .
#Text=John , a pseudonym for one such Iraqi , said to Al-Jazeera , " It ’s a fact to these people , we betrayed our country , anyone who worked with the Americans .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Mark , another such Iraqi , said  All the people around me know that I was working with the Americans .

column1: #Text=And , " For nine months I am jobless , waiting for that visa .
